message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper uses machine learning techniques to analyze policy documents related to forest and landscape restoration. Specifically, it uses neural information retrieval to classify policy agenda labels as information retrieval queries. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and machine learning applied to text. The paper also uses transfer learning and word embeddings, which are common techniques in cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses unsupervised learning, which is a common topic in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper deals with environmental policy, which could fall under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
